examples.text: I had a close contact with a covid-risk person
my father has degenerative bone disease
my mother has degenerative bone disease
my sister has degenerative bone disease
I have a mass on my body
there a lump on my body
there is a growth on my body
I am having this pain for long time
I have this for long time
I have this pain for a long time
it is a long term issue
I have rash on my skin
I have redness on my skin
I was bitten by an insect

values.value: I am allergic to a plant that provokes redness
I have a condition where my pores are blocked creating redness
I have been bitten a dog
I have been bitten by an insect
I was in direct someone infected with a ringworm

values.text: Your symptoms seem to be in line with degenerative bone diseases. Medica suggests that you contact your family doctor as soon as possible to establish further treatment.
Can you be a bit more specific about your symptoms?

Due to increasing cases of Covid-19, I have to direct you a quick questionnaire regarding Covid-19. You may have Covid-19. Have you been in close contact to someone with high risk (coughing, without mask) in the last days?
I got your answer, thank you.
It seems like you were in an accident. Are you in a capacity to call emergencies (112), or are you seeking help concerning another person?
Your pain does not seem to have anything to do with your family history, let us continue.
Alright, I am glad. You should still get checked every 6 months if cancer runs in your family.
Are your symptoms due to a single event trauma related to an accident or injury?

I would highly recommend you to go to the nearest hospital for a BT and a PCR test for COVID-19. You can follow the guidelines here: https://www.spain.info/en/discover-spain/practical-information-tourists-covid-19-travel-spain/.
Can you please shortly elaborate what diseases run in your family so we can further assess your case?

Since your pain is located in the central part of the body and that your family has a history of cardiovascular diseases, you should still contact a doctor. In the urgency, and if you feel like you are going to faint make sure you are with someone who can get instructions from a medical team.

I am sorry to hear this. Mental health is unfortunately out of my reach. If you are feeling alone and depressive I can suggest my good friend Eve the Chatbot to keep you company: https://www.eviebot.com/en/

generic.title: Now, I should ask you the severity of your pain in the relevant region from low to high (low, medium, high)?

values.text: I am so sorry that it happened. You condition can be very serious. Tell me if you see any sudden growths, lumps on or around the pain area?

Does the pain associated have the following symptoms: joint stiffness, limited range of motion
bumps or deformities of the joint, creaking or grinding when you move the joint?

If the person you are with is unconscious, please call the number 112. Then you should make sure she is in a lateral security position. DO NOT TRY TO MOVE HER BODY AS THIS MIGHT CAUSE SEVERE HEMORRHAGE AND BLOOD LOSS.
Yes
It seems like you have a lump or a cyst. Most cysts are harmless but you should nonetheless get in contact with a general practitioner as they can also be a source of cancer and other diseases.

It seems like you have a rash. Can you please tell us if you have been in contact with an allergen, a specific plant, animal, bug, have been using drugs or have been in contact with someone infected with a ringworm?
I cannot help you with your condition, you should seek medical help from a professional.
Have you been diagnosed with cancer yourself?
Diabetes is something you should see with a licensed practitioner.  However, your injury might not be related to it.
Have you or a member of your family ever been diagnosed with degenerative bones disease, osteoporosis or arthritis?

dialog_nodes.title: Family history is being taken in general

values.text: Do you have a history of degenerative, cancers, or any other genetic diseases in your family?

A common type of rash caused by drugs is known as the "drug rash". If you stop your consumption it should eventually fade but we suggest you take an appointment with a general practitioner since bad cases of this can lead to necrosis.

dialog_nodes.title: Can I help you with anything else(needs to be connected to conclusion)

values.text: Is there anything else I can help you with?
Are you feeling dizzy, numbness, and experiencing the overall symptoms of a heart attack?

Call 112 immediately. 
Chew and swallow an aspirin, unless you are allergic to aspirin or have been told by your doctor never to take aspirin. 
Take nitroglycerin, if prescribed. If you think you're having a heart attack and your doctor has previously prescribed nitroglycerin for you, take it as directed. Don't take anyone else's nitroglycerin, because that could put you in more danger.
Cancer is unfortunately out of our diagnosis reach. You should seek professional help from a doctor or clinic.
Have you been diagnosed with diabetes?

I am glad to hear that you obey rules and keep social distance. Don't forget to use mask and frequently wash your hands. I have very bad memory nowadays, can you repeat the body region that you are having pain?

dialog_nodes.title: Just incase the user doesn't greet us

values.text: Please, tell me the magic word "hello" to start again.
If you have psoriasis, there is no real cure available at the moment. You should nonetheless seek the help of a dermatologist.

A bite by an animal should never be treated lightly, especially if it was a wild animal. You should call the number 112 and go straight to a hospital to prevent a rabies case if you have not been vaccinated.
Do you have cough, smell and taste loss, or chest pain?
It looks like you don't have an emergent condition. Stay home and rest a little bit and check with us in 24 hours.

You don't have infection or bleeding under your skin. I haven't suspected anything emergent but I still suggest you to see a doctor as soon as possible. Good bye. Re-evaluate with us after your hospital visit.

It seems like you are bleeding, in case of immediate urgency please call the number 112. If this is a mild cut, rinse it under cold water and then disinfect it with alcohol, patch it up and check on it every 24/hours.
You should try to find an EpiPen straight away and alert your surroundings. This type of allergy can be lethal. Call an ambulance at 112 if you cannot find an immediate solution.
Before we get started, let me ask you a few questions? Could you tell where your pain is?
Is there a redness, broken skin, or bleeding on or around the area?

dialog_nodes.title: If no lump ask for infection

values.text: Do you think there are any signs that the area might be infected? If it is infected you may have excessive redness, swelling or yellow/green colored discharge.

There is a high change that you are bleeding under your skin. I would highly recommend you to call an ambulance to take you to the nearest hospital. Here is the number: 112. Don't forget to re-evaluate after your hospital visit.

It looks like you are infected. Infection can get very dangerous if not treated immediately. I would suggest to call an ambulance as soon as possible. Here is the number you should call: 112. Re-evaluate with us after your hospital visit.

dialog_nodes.title: If person is unconscious and not breathing (needs intent)

values.text: Begin CPR if the person is unconscious. If you're with a person who is unconscious, tell the 112 dispatchers or another emergency medical specialist. You may be advised to begin cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR).

A slight bleeding and low pain doesn't look so emergent. You can go to the nearest pharmacy to get band id if you have a small scratch or bleeding. Don't forget to come back to re-evaluate with us in 24 hours. Good bye for now.

A slight rash and low pain doesn't look so emergent. You can go to the nearest pharmacy if you have a small scratch or bleeding. Don't forget to come back to re-evaluate with us in 24 hours. Good bye for now.

A slight scar doesn't look so emergent. You can go to the nearest pharmacy to get band id if you have a small scratch or bleeding. Don't forget to come back to re-evaluate with us in 24 hours. Good bye for now.
You can go to the nearest pharmacy if you have a small scratch or bleeding. Don't forget to come back to re-evaluate with us in 24 hours. Good bye for now.
(This chatbot is not intended for diagnose. You should consult to your doctor before making final decisions on your treatments). Hello. I am Medica, your medical assistant today.
(This chatbot is not intended for diagnose. You should consult to your doctor before making final decisions on your treatments). Hi! I am Medica, your online trauma severity assessment tool.
